title: PSA: Abuse your team mates, it will improve their performance
body: Sounds stupid doesn't it? That's because it is. So why do people do it?

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=CrepeVictim,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=rscAKMRZ,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-05-05T05:41:56.401+0000)
>
> Sounds stupid doesn&#039;t it? That&#039;s because it is. So why do people do it?

Because sometimes.. It is just easier to say " You fail "
Then explain 

Freezing a lane.
Pushing a lane.
Last hitting.
CS DOES MATTER.
Move about in lane. 
Make your movement random. Not just side to side.


Sometimes. You just want to say " I am sick of people like you. "

Unless they ask for help, they probably don't want your condescending input. Ever considered that?
Everyone learns at their own pace. Abusing people or negative comments do no speed up this process.

Everyone cuts lose every now then. 
Even my GF does.. She never types much in a game. But every now and then she just cuts lose.

I totally understand that getting frustrated happens in game, and it really sucks. **The difference between being a positive player and a negative player, is how you handle this frustration.**

I once had a friend that was pretty toxic. He voices all of his frustrations out in chat, and found himself permabanned.

I am more toxic than this friend. The difference is that I say what I am thinking out loud, to prevent it from creating a negative atmosphere in game. I know that the words I say in chat can make or break team morale and directly influence the game. 

* Toxic speaking out of game, ridiculously positive, encouraging, motivational words in game.

If you have constructive criticism to give, wait till the end of game. In game, virtually nobody wants to be told how to play. Especially in bronze. Once you are out of game, put yourself in their shoes. 

* Is their score super ultra trash?
*  Have they copped abuse from other members of your team? 

Then they probably don't want to hear your advice and just want to move on as fast as possible. 

Even if you and your GF only let lose "once in a while", you can still end up being punished.
It's actually easier to say nothing at all.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7xrxrEEGVdM&spfreload=10 
LET RONAN KEATING EXPLAIN IT FOR US ALL
Agreed. If you have no **constructive ideas** to help your teammate, say nothing.
On the contrary, self restrain for some would be the true challenge.

When you never have to see these people again, it can be easier to vent at them rather than teach each person how to play.
That being said, I think it'd just be better to keep the comments to yourself rather than venting at someone who's learning.
But hey, everyone's different.
To bad people in this game think anything is abuse, tell someone to ward and not pushup and they mute and report you lol
Also hate to be that guy but if you let words in a video game from a person you don't know or care about hurt you then you are mentally weak and shouldn't be on this game
flaming and shit talking is half the fun
